name: The Langham, Sydney

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We stayed here the last night of our honeymoon and were blown away. It was beautiful, well maintained, modern yet very, very cozy. It's also in a lovely location - so close to the attractions, but in more of a residential area and right near the Observatory, which we found preferable to being among the impersonal, high-rise buildings of downtown Sydney. The staff was incredibly helpful and made us feel so comfortable. Highly, highly recommend - I wish we'd stayed longer!!
reviews.title: Simply perfection

likes.liked: — Cozy, elegant, convenient, great service - all the things we love most in a hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008
reviews.text: I was really looking forward to this one. It is for sure a nice - old style hotel. Once the concierge warmed up to me - he was great too. However, I stayed there for a week and staff only greeted me in a "welcome back" way the last couple of days - so the personal touch was missing and I found that really dissappointing. Internet access is far too expensive.
reviews.title: Loved the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best thing is the location. You can walk around easily and there are nice bars and restaurants in the area.
reviews.title: outstanding boutique hotel with impecable service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would I return...maybe.
reviews.title: Loved the Observatory

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: This hotel was wonderful. It is only a 10 minute walk to the harbor, etc. The concierge service was impecable. We mailed a package back to the us; however it was not signed for at home and it was mailed back to australia. Due to the incredible service of the concierge, they were able to trace and get it back to us and kept us up to date the entire time. Every restaurant tour they recommended was absolutely perfect. loved it and made our trip to sydney special as it was one of 9 stops as we went around the world.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Sydney

likes.liked: — blaconies or opening windows and beautiful bathrooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008
reviews.text: We changed to this hotel whilst in a lounge awaiting to fly to Sydney. We asked for a car to collect us but on arrival to Sydney there was not one there. I called and went through 3 people before I got told there was not one coming. I was annoyed as the queue for cabs was long.
reviews.title: Best concierge ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At the hotel the reception staff were poor to be honest. Did not really get why I was cross or apologise. I wanted to walk out there and then but Michael one of the concierge's came over and took control of the situation and took us to the breakfast room and we had breakfast on the house.
reviews.title: Fab spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: The room (Junior suite with water view)was ok. It was not luxurious but clean and comfortable. It is a 5* but quite old.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels I've stayed at

likes.disliked: — room service did not serve the food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is perfect for the Opera house etc and on a quiet road.
reviews.title: Simply the best!

likes.disliked: — Initially the price but now realise it is worth every cent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Michael and his team are top notch. He was so very very helpful in getting us reservations, car hire, directions etc. Ask him for any help. He makes this hotel!
reviews.title: No better Concierges

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Highlight: Observatory hotel
reviews.title: The Great Gatsby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: I am sitting at a redwood desk writing out my thoughts with a pen, something I have not done in more than two decades. On an academician’s salary, I cannot live a life of quiet luxury, but I can steal it for a day, and I have. My hotel has a roaring 20’s decor and looks like it was frequented by the Great Gatsby. My room has curved ceilings and is upholstered in thick multivaried materials. The red, olive and cream drapes line a spectacular full wall view of Sydney’s bay. I see both boats and birds sailing by, and below are rustic-roofed brick tenements. It is very quiet. And – oh my goodness, there is now a full rainbow in my view!
reviews.title: Loved It
The Observatory was outstanding
reviews.text: The bed is soft with goose down and the room service coffee is a delicious French roast . I mean to swim in the Observatory’s famous planetarium pool , but I don’t want to leave my room. [A sidenote: The Observatory was the ONLY hotel to provide an American style “pot” of coffee. Everywhere else, I had to order double cappuccinos.]

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did finally go to the pool and spa. The steam in the steam-room was heavily scented with lemongrass.
reviews.title: Pure Bliss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The Asian influenced food (vegetable curry, rice soup with shrimp and calamari) at the Observatory was perfect. When asked how spicy I wanted it, I replied “American-medium”, and the server nodded as if this were a perfectly reasonable response. My choice of table, one in front of the window by the piano and antique book-shelves, was reserved for me for the duration of my stay. ps –the books were all original editions from the 1800’s, but they were too boring to read.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel
Second class treatment
reviews.text: While The Observatory is an impressive property, the level of service falls far below the standard of the amenities. After reading the hotel website's claims about its superior standards, we booked an internet weekend package on another website to celebrate our wedding anniversary. After making advance arrangements for babysitting and all the other logistics that come with a weekend away once children arrive, we arrived shortly after check-in to be told that there were no double rooms, as described on the website. Instead, we were being "upgraded" to a room with two King singles. We politely declined the upgrade pointing out that it was our wedding anniversary and we would prefer a double bed. Reception told us that there was nothing they could do, as the hotel reserved the right to reallocate rooms booked over the internet. There was no attempt at service recovery - not even an offer to make up the singles as a double - and to add insult to injury, the platter of strawberries which made up part of the internet "deal" never arrived. We made the best of our stay but didn't witness any of the superior service or attention to guests' needs which the hotel's publicity promised. All in all, a disappointing stay - clearly those who book over the internet are second-class citizens at The Observatory.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at The Observatory for 6 nights over two weeks (it was our home base as we travelled throughout Australia and NZ). The hotel is stunning, the service is warm and helpful and the location - even though slightly off the beat and path was perfect for us. We arranged our restaurant reservations with the concierge via email from the U.S. They were there to hold our bags and to make sure everything was perfect. As we got back to Sydney from our other destinations - we looked forward to coming back to the Observatory as they made it feel like home. We can't wait to come back!
reviews.title: Finest Hotel We've Been To

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband proposed to me at this beautiful hotel last year. The entire staff was absolutely wonderful, accommodating and truly excited for us during our stay.
reviews.title: Perfect Engagement
Excellent hotel
reviews.text: The room was beautiful; we stayed in a suite overlooking the water and enjoyed amazing sunsets from our balcony. The bathroom was large and luxurious and the canopy bed was very comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had breakfast in the lobby restaurant every morning which was large and delicious. My favorites were the excellent banana bread and every juice you could possibly imagine.
reviews.title: Super Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Observatory hotel in July. I certainly have no hesitation in recommending the hotel to those looking for a very comfortable place to stay in Sydney.
reviews.title: Watch out for the espresso!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is convenient and within easy walking distance of the centre of the city and the Rocks. We found the staff to be extremely helpful at all times. The rooms are of a high standard - furnished with antique style furniture and with very large bathrooms. The indoor pool is quite spectacular.
reviews.title: Top place to visit

likes.liked: — Luxurious, old world English charm - great bathroom.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our only concern was with the breakfast provided by the hotel. We arranged a package inclusive of full buffet breakfast each day. On the first morning, I was approached by the waiter and asked if I would like coffee with breakfast. I accepted. After finishing the coffee, I was offered another which I again accepted. It disappointed me that I was given a $14 bill at the end of breakfast (each coffee cost $7!) There was no alternative in terms of self serve coffee. I have stayed at many inferior hotels to the Observatory both in terms of price and overall service around the world and have never found coffee not to be included with a full breakfast. By charging for what is a routine part of breakfast, the hotel does itself a disservice.
reviews.title: Exceptional service; a real paradise that we will always remember

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was a lovely place to stay, within walking distance of The Rocks district and the weekend market, within walking distance to the Queen Victoria bld. and great shopping. It had been recommended to us by good friends who visit top accommodation spots regularly.
reviews.title: Beautiful, refined hotel with great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was quiet, beautifully appointed in an old world Engish charm way, we had a jnior suite which was really lovely, lots of room, great bathroom and very attentive staff.
reviews.title: A splendid place in Sydney

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second visit and it was just as good as we remembered. Obviously a brilliant location and service was understated efficiency at its best. Make use of the concierge - I think they are the best Ive ever used anywhere. Superb Spa. Cracking rooms - super comfy beds (huge) and amazing bathrooms. Not really sure what else they can do to make it any better! Brilliant - and justifiably expensive.
reviews.title: Genuinely exceptional

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a city-view room at the Observatory hotel after weeks of weighing up the pros and cons of various nice hotels around Sydney, reading reviews, checking prices, etc. As it was a special occasion, I wanted to find a hotel that could pretty much guarantee a perfect stay, so my expectations were fairly high.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay at the Observatory

likes.disliked: — It was all wonderful, although the location is a little further from the CBD than some hotels.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Observatory allows small pets in some of its rooms, so I initially got in contact with them via email to see if there are any rooms that have not had animals in them, due to allergies. Luckily only select rooms are pet-friendly, so this was fine. The customer service via email was so good (the girl was very helpful and friendly) that I ended up booking a room this way. As my budget was low, I could only afford the cheapest room - a city-view room - and breakfast (valued at $45 per person) at the restaurant was included for no extra charge, which was great.
reviews.title: 5 star? Yeah Right.
DIsappointing
reviews.text: Booking the lowest-priced room, I expected that it would be pretty small, but the photos on the site looked very nice, and it's sort of old-fashioned, and just a bit prettier than some of the more modern hotels. To my surprise, the room was actually very large. By "city-view", it's more a view across the street of houses, but this was quite nice, and the street wasn't at all busy. Being able to open a window (in addition to air-condioning, of course) is a bit of a novelty after staying in high-rise hotels. The bathroom was fairly large as well, and as beautiful as the rest of our room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff were extremely efficient, polite, welcoming and professional at all times, and we were even taken to our room by a staff member. Despite my high expectations, the Observatory Hotel and its staff managed to exceed these expectations. The strawberries waiting for us in our room were unexpected and a nice touch.
reviews.title: The Observatory is a fantastic hotel

likes.liked: — The rooms are gorgeous and comfortable.
likes.disliked: — Location is a bit out of the way for downtown and beds were a little small.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: This is a real gem of a hotel. We've stayed in many hotels, in many countries, and this has got to be the best yet, and we only had a "basic" room. The room was superb and very roomy with huge bed TV cabinet, desk, table for two and lounge chair with ottoman. Our room faced the street but noise was not a problem. Bathroom was lovely and the whole room immaculate.
reviews.title: Best we've stayed at

likes.liked: — Wonderful room, excellent staff and attention to detail in all aspects.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What made the hotel particularly special was the staff and the attention to detail. A lot of thought had gone into making our stay enjoyable. All the staff were extraordinary in their approach.
reviews.title: very nice, neighborhood location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had one meal at the hotel and this was a lovely 7 course degustation amply complemented by wine selected with the help of an excellent sommelier. We'll be back!
reviews.title: Great hotel stay--with one dining caveat

likes.liked: — Excellent service, slightly off the beaten path location
likes.disliked: — Dinner at its restaurant was terrible.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Observatory Hotel is an Oriental Express property and it truly does have the highest attention to detail I have ever witnessed. The personal service was outstanding. They provided everything we asked for and more (although I guess they don't use curling irons in Sydney as they could not come up with one of those) Being only a couple of stories high there was a very small amount of street noise coming in.
reviews.title: Not normally where we would stay but we loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: It is indeed located near Sydney's historic Rocks district, although somewhat off the beaten path. It is locating in a little neighborhood with a view of a working port. We made the walk to Circular Quay many times which was not bad at all. It's coming back up that hill at the end of a long day that gets you.
reviews.title: Pretty disappointing start

likes.liked: — Quiet location, peaceful hotel and day spa, nice indoor pool, sauna and gym, nice food
likes.disliked: — A hassle being put in 2 dirty rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: Quote from letter to manager of the hotel: I've now just returned to the UK but would like to thank you and your staff. I had a wonderful trip to New Zealand and Australia, and my visit to the Observatory certainly stands out as a highlight. The hotel is so superbly located but at the same time away from the main area of hotels and thus feels much more of a "home". It was a pleasure to come back to at the end of each day - I was usually very weary and footsore from sightseeing! I would also like to compliment all your staff but in particular Simon the concierge who was so helpful to me in sorting out arrangements that I had made for a tour which didn't actually take place! I also loved the swimming pool! I am a regular swimmer and used most of the hotel pools on my 6 week trip, but yours really was by far the best - an absolute delight
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: what a wonderful presentation of this superb hotel. staff rooms facilities were all great.
reviews.title: 1st class hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the position is just 10 min walk from the centre of town or the harbour and nothing is to much trouble for the very profeesional staff.
reviews.title: A Faultless Pleasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we loved it
reviews.title: Always excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you crave the slimline, high design anonymity of a corporate 5 star, don't bother with this place. However, if you're looking for a timeless haven staffed entirely by personable, but not familiar, people who seem to delight in recalling your name, your coffee preference and the kind of day you had, don't bother with anywhere else.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - for Certain Travelers

description: In the heart of Sydney, experience Australia’s most awarded Hotel, where boutique luxury is assured and personalised service unsurpassed. The Observatory Hotel is the ideal base from which to work and explore Sydney Australia's most vibrant city. Superbly located near Sydney's historic Rocks and central business district, nestled near the vibrant harbour and the world famous Sydney Harbour Bridge, this is an enviable location close to the bustling heart of the city.
